intro: Clarkia caurina, commonly known as the silverleaf clarkia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes, and it thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and silver-gray in appearance, giving the plant its common name. Clarkia caurina is often found in disturbed soils and is adapted to arid environments.
